page.title: 03Swimbridge 1985
page.content: The village of Swimbridge, with a population of approximately 850 is situated on the A.361 trunk road from Barnstaple to Taunton.{It is a large {attractive settlement with a General {Stores, Post Office, Butchers shop and {Public House. There is a resident sign-writer and thatcher with many other interesting characters. Although a few people are still engaged in agriculture Swimbridge has developed into a commuter village for Barnstaple, four miles to the west. As a result{house prices}are relatively high by North Devon standards. There has been some {housing}development during the past two decades but the village retains much of it's charm. There is no play area although the School uses the Glebe Field for {sporting activities.
